refnamediv.refpurpose: a modular IRC proxy with multi-server support

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: ctrlproxy is a modular IRC proxy. It connects to a number of IRC servers and then passes data it receives on to the modules that have been loaded into it. Current modules are client_simple (for proxy support) and log (for irssi-style log file generation).
By default, ctrlproxy listens for client connections on port 6668 and any ports after that one, depending on the number of servers it is connected to.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: ctrlproxy recognizes the following command-line options

listitem.para: Add incoming client on stdin/stdout, connected to the specified network. This can be used for inetd-like communication and testing.
Dump IRC traffic to specified file. Only useful for debugging purposes.
Go to the background after the program has been started (daemon mode).
Read configuration files from the specified directory DIR instead of from .ctrlproxy in the users' homedirectory.
Show help message with short argument information
Log ctrlproxy messages to specified file.

refsect1.title: SIGNALS
refsect1.para: When ctrlproxy receives a USR1 signal, it will save it's current state.

listitem.para: Override directory that will be searched for plugins.
